games.Title: Puppets at War
games.Description: All the puppets in the City have been invited to the neighborhood of make believe to discuss cooperation.

Fight to Survive: Role-playing Martial Arts Meets Heart
A heartbreaking, struggling, mundane, down-and-dirty game about martial artists in the 20th century where most situations are violent and usually end in sadness. Bloodsport, Streets of Fire, Hard Times, Final Fight, The Karate Kid, Ninja III: The Domination—the thrill of martial arts actions meets the hard streets of New Hope City. No experience with the system necessary. Be a part of the action, and join the fun.

Successfully Kickstarted and released just this summer, Fight to Survive: Role-playing Martial Arts Meets Heart is a brand new game from the indie weirdos at Radio James Games. Learn more at www.radiojamesgames.com.

games.Title: Fairyland
games.Description:
t is 1892, you and your family are not making life work in the new world. So, you have decided to uproot and head back to your ancestral home of Cullingston, Scotland to have a quieter pace of life...or did you?

Content Warnings: Children in Peril/Possible Harm, Possible Body Gore, Possible Sweariing, Very Bleak Story
Safety Tools Engaged
3 Players MAX

games.Title: Dead on the Water
games.Description: The continent holds nothing for you, now. Whether running from boredom, obligations, loss, debt, or crimes, it's time to leave this place. You've booked passage on a carrack leaving from Amn for the Moonsahe Isle, towards a new life. However, it's not only your fellow passengers who carry dark secrets with them. Will you make it to safe harbour, or are you sailing into the jaws of death? Dead on the Water is a 5e D&D 5th-level adventure for 4-6 players. Pre-generated characters will be provided.

games.Title: Rails of New Eden
games.Description:
The crew recently got their ship, the Cu Challain, up and operational and now it’s time to start making some credits. Your fence, Fenek, has a line on some work that promises solid pay, but your ship is way out in the outer Chi arm of the galaxy, and the job is on New Eden, a planet near the galactic core. It’d take months to get there and the job has two days at most. Get ready for a jump…and be on your best behaviour. This is where the rich people live..



Action Potential is a Canadian-made “Forged in the Dark” system, set in the far future, where humanity has claimed much of the known galaxy. The economic divide has continued to widen and most of humanity only has custody of their consciousness, their bodies taken as collateral. You play as free personae, out to make a name for yourself in the galaxy by stealing the wealth of the rich. You jump in and out of bodies, some flesh, some artificial, in order to see your job done. Can you survive the depths of space and the power of the rich, in order to rob another day?

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description:
Mosaic is an action selection game. On your turn, you will perform one of seven actions and acquire components.

Acquiring Components is important in creating the unique mosaic of your civilization. They are used as prerequisites for many new technologies, as well as for scoring. Also, by pursuing specialization in one or more Civilization Components, you may be able to claim a ‘Golden Age’ of that type.

games.Title: Hyperborea-Rel's Smile
games.Description: The vast city of Khromarium promises new opportunities for those starting adventurers looking for opportunity. A vast place of sprawling buildings and smoke stacks that billow plumes of black smoke from the many factories and shops within its city walls. Cramped city streets filled with the unwashed bodies of thousands with many amazing sites to behold. You are a new hopeful wide eyed visitor to the city. Perhaps good fortune has arrived finaly and Rel (the god of luck and adventurers) has indeed smiled upon you. Hyperborea is a OSR 1e AD&D game based fantasy RPG which combines the spirit of conan, cuthulu and a dash of science fiction.

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description: HeroQuest is Milton Bradley's approach to a Dungeons & Dragons-style adventure game. One player acts as game master, revealing the maze-like dungeon piecemeal as the players wander. Up to four other players take on a character (wizard, elf, dwarf, or barbarian) and venture forth into dungeons on fantasy quests. Plastic miniatures and 3-D furniture make this game very approachable.

games.Title: Board Game (10-noon)
games.Description:
5 players
Help tame the Red Planet
Compete with other players to transform Mars into an earthly paradise using everything from bio-engineered bacteria to slamming a massive asteroid into the ground.

games.Title: Board Game (noon to 2)
games.Description:
5 players
Create an island with its own unique self-supporting ecosystem. The strategy involves out growing your opponents and utilizing their abilities for your purposes

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description: n Teotihuacan: City of Gods, each player commands a force of worker dice, which grow in strength with every move. On your turn, you move a worker around a modular board, always choosing one of two areas of the location tile you land on: one offering you an action (and a worker upgrade), the other providing you with a powerful bonus (but without an upgrade).

games.Title: Minature Wargame
games.Description: Across the far-flung worlds of the Imperium of Mankind, in a galaxy riven by warp storms and unceasing conflict, the armies of Humanity battle for survival. With the Imperium already standing upon the brink of annihilation, the Tyranid hive fleets emerge from the cold void between the stars. The Space Marines stand as the last line of defence between this ravenous alien menace and the beleaguered worlds of the Imperium.

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description:
World Delver, a co-op open world deck building game during the crusades for 1-4 players, 12+. Each player will design a military company composed of a fully personalized chief and his retainers in an attempt to accomplish his chief's life goal to win the game (ex: kill a specific boss, succeed a particular contract, etc.)
Players will need to travel the world map to explore different locations, each with unique interactions and contracts to take. Each contract will involve player decisions and will impact the contract conclusion. The system controls the enemies during the battles.
There is also a story, a versus and an rpg mode to do your own thing. Age 12+

games.Title: THE STONE OF ROC ROCK
games.Description:
Blurb: The Heroes of Heroton haven't returned from their quest for the holy Stone of Roc Rock. Now fate calls the Other, Other Heroes of Heroton: Illusionist! Assassin! Bard! Monk! Druid!

ELEMENTAL is a fast, flexible system for any character, any setting, any story! All players get a prize! https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/242198/ELEMENTAL-Complete-Guide?fbclid=IwAR1iiOCz6dT34VcKKQi65BRvRqHGuQy6X8G6P17x7Ov1kogUE2X7c-bX0sQ

This is a story game (eewww!) without dice (yuck!)—actually, there are dice sometimes—faithfully creating the experience of Saturday morning playtime. There are many systems for excellently representing barbarians with blasters, so this does not try to be one of them. Instead, it is 19-eighty-something, and you are a six to ten-year-old child, playing with your friends until the final battle is won for good, and Skeletor cries: "I'll get you He-Man, if it's the last thing I do!"

games.Title: The Mystery at the Museum
games.Description:
The museum is the cultural and intellectual cornerstone of the town, featuring countless artifacts. Lately, however, its halls have been empty, its coffers emptier. The guests and employees have begun to go missing. The townsfolk have begun rumbling about burning the museum to the ground. Desperate for help, the curator turns to a group of adventurers to solve the mystery at the museum.

A D&D 5e adventure suitable for characters form levels 1-4. Level 3 pre-gens will be available

games.Title: Arctic Intrigue
games.Description:
The team is contracted for some remote work up in the Athabaskan Council. A remote facility is manufacturing some controversial tech that their competitors would rather not reach production and the closest major city, Yellowknife, is light on shadowrunner talent. Work with the locals to locate the precise location of the facility and then put a stop to this new biotechnology before it goes to market.

Shadowrun is a near-future, alternate Earth where magic returned to the world in 2012. Along with it came the races of myth and legend, like elves, trolls and dragons. Technology continued to advance, making cybernetics, AIs and mind-linked computers a reality. With a mix of magic and machine, corporations vastly control the world and it is the criminals in the shadows of those skyscrapers that keep the world from devolving into a capitalist hellscape. You’re a shadowrunner. Welcome to the gutter, chummer.

games.Title: Crivens!
games.Description: The Nac Mac Feegles are oot it again. Who knows what the boys will be getting into this time. But guaranteed it will be full of mayhem, stealing, and general shenanigans.

games.Title: Hyperborea-A Wayward Daughter
games.Description: The call for adventure has brought you to the small settlement of Entella far in the northern lands. This small community has a need for those strong of sword arm, stealth and sorcery. A warrior maidens smile and a promise of a vast treasure waiting to be taken. If you are brave enough that is ! Hyperborea is a OSR 1e AD&D game based fantasy RPG which combines the spirit of conan, cuthulu and a dash of science fiction.

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description: HeroQuest is Milton Bradley's approach to a Dungeons & Dragons-style adventure game. One player acts as game master, revealing the maze-like dungeon piecemeal as the players wander. Up to four other players take on a character (wizard, elf, dwarf, or barbarian) and venture forth into dungeons on fantasy quests. Plastic miniatures and 3-D furniture make this game very approachable.

Modern-day paranormal investigators based out of Ottawa.

Sessions will be based on ghost stories from around the Peterborough area.

games.Title: Board Game (1 hour)
games.Description:
6 players
Play competing crews of pirate ships, each trying to best the other to collect treasure and avoid curses. Your deck of characters can include everything from a witch and a voodoo master to a monkey and a parrot. Very interactive.

games.Title: Board Game (1 hour)
games.Description:
6 players
The players are one of six different train robbers, fighting each other for as much money as possible all while avoiding the marshall and trying not to get shot or robbed.

games.Title: Board Game (1 hour)
games.Description:
7 players
Each player runs a different empire from the ancient world, each with it's own special abilities. You can trade with your neighbours, attack them, or sometimes both. An award winning classic

games.Title: Board Game (1 hour)
games.Description:
6 players
Bribe, blackmail, or force various characters to do your bidding for the turn and slowly take control of various locations all the while trying to stop the other players from doing the same. You can do everything from bribing the priest to blackmailing the viceroy. You can take control of the tavern or occupy the palace. This is an extremely interactive game. The randomness of your effects is entirely dependent on how well you can second guess the other players while trying not to second guess yourself. This game has the most "Duoooh!" factor of any game I've seen.

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description: America in the 19th century: You are a rancher and repeatedly herd your cattle from Texas to Kansas City, where you send them off by train. This earns you money and victory points. Needless to say, each time you arrive in Kansas City, you want to have your most valuable cattle in tow. However, the "Great Western Trail" not only requires that you keep your herd in good shape, but also that you wisely use the various buildings along the trail. Also, it might be a good idea to hire capable staff: cowboys to improve your herd, craftsmen to build your very own buildings, or engineers for the important railroad line.

games.Title: Minature Wargame
games.Description: Across the far-flung worlds of the Imperium of Mankind, in a galaxy riven by warp storms and unceasing conflict, the armies of Humanity battle for survival. With the Imperium already standing upon the brink of annihilation, the Tyranid hive fleets emerge from the cold void between the stars. The Space Marines stand as the last line of defence between this ravenous alien menace and the beleaguered worlds of the Imperium.

1948 during the 'uranium rush' in the Soviet Union - the players will be part of an official expedition descending into a cave in the Siberian mountains in search of uranium and archaeological/anthropological finds and discover that something ancient and alien lurks in its depths. The players will have to juggle survival and altruism in a totalitarian environment where they could
> find themselves condemned for 'unsoviet activities'.

games.Title: Captain Apocalypse
games.Description: When the asteroid hit Captain Planet disappeared, now some years later your find some interesting rings

games.Title: The Faulkeners’ Dream Maze
games.Description:
You are on the road to the funeral of a daughter of the family. She died of a drug overdose. Along the night-time woodland road you see a naked man run in front of the car, he’s wearing antlers and has a mouth full of razor sharp teeth giving him a nightmarish look. You swerve and crash.

All is dark.

Content Warnings: Drugs & Alcohol, Family Member Death and Repercussions, Possible Body Gore, Swearing, Warped Realities, Think Hellraiser type horror....
Safety Tools Engaged
3 Players MAX
Beginner Friendly
Ages 18-21+

games.Title: The Mystery at the Museum
games.Description:
The museum is the cultural and intellectual cornerstone of the town, featuring countless artifacts. Lately, however, its halls have been empty, its coffers emptier. The guests and employees have begun to go missing. The townsfolk have begun rumbling about burning the museum to the ground. Desperate for help, the curator turns to a group of adventurers to solve the mystery at the museum.

A D&D 5e adventure suitable for characters form levels 1-4. Level 3 pre-gens will be available

games.Title: The end of the world is now
games.Description:
THEY are coming. Its dark, its terrifying and it looks like this is it. What will you do at the end of the world?

10 Candles is a one shot horror RPG. The game play can be quite scary and the atmosphere is distinctly spooky. Great for lovers of horror, not so great for the faint of heart. Not for the under 18.

games.Title: An Analog Horror RPG
games.Description:
An analog Japanese horror ttrpg inspired by anthology horror manga, World of Horror, and the works of Junji Ito.
As summer break fast approaches, you almost didn't notice Shito, the quiet kid from your middle school, missing class. It wasn't until you went looking in his desk for a pencil to borrow that you found strange writings in his notebook that made you think his absence was something more than the rumor of a nasty head cold. It's time for you and your friends to find your classmate if he's even alive.

Players: 1-6 Mystery Horror Game No experience Dice provided upon request

games.Title: Pudding Faire
games.Description:
BREAK A CURSE THAT ECHOES THROUGH TIME!

You awaken on the morning of the Pudding Faire: just as you did yesterday… and the day before that… and the day before that! To escape the loop, you must break a curse that strikes to the heart of halfling and gnome lore.

games.Title: Hyperborea-A Wayward Daughter
games.Description: The call for adventure has brought you to the small settlement of Entella far in the northern lands. This small community has a need for those strong of sword arm, stealth and sorcery. A warrior maidens smile and a promise of a vast treasure waiting to be taken. If you are brave enough that is ! Hyperborea is a OSR 1e AD&D game based fantasy RPG which combines the spirit of conan, cuthulu and a dash of science fiction.

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description: HeroQuest is Milton Bradley's approach to a Dungeons & Dragons-style adventure game. One player acts as game master, revealing the maze-like dungeon piecemeal as the players wander. Up to four other players take on a character (wizard, elf, dwarf, or barbarian) and venture forth into dungeons on fantasy quests. Plastic miniatures and 3-D furniture make this game very approachable.

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description:
Part of the Munchkin series.

Epic Munchkin is a set of rules that expands nearly every game in the Munchkin series. It has the following features:

The game ends at level 20 instead of level 10.
Upon reaching level 10, the rules change for the "Open a Door" phase to make it harder.
Upon reaching level 10, there are new abilities for races, classes, loyalties, accents, and steeds, as well as for the "Master", "High", and "Dark" cards from Munchkin Dice.

games.Title: Board Game (8-10pm)
games.Description:
5 players
Help tame the Red Planet
Compete with other players to transform Mars into an earthly paradise using everything from bio-engineered bacteria to slamming a massive asteroid into the ground.

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description:
Dominant Species is a game that abstractly recreates a tiny portion of ancient history: the ponderous encroachment of an ice age and what that entails for the living creatures trying to adapt to the slowly-changing earth.
Each player will assume the role of one of six major animal classes—mammal, reptile, bird, amphibian, arachnid, or insect. Each begins the game more or less in a state of natural balance in relation to one another. But that won’t last: It is indeed "survival of the fittest".

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description:
World Delver, a co-op open world deck building game during the crusades for 1-4 players, 12+. Each player will design a military company composed of a fully personalized chief and his retainers in an attempt to accomplish his chief's life goal to win the game (ex: kill a specific boss, succeed a particular contract, etc.)
Players will need to travel the world map to explore different locations, each with unique interactions and contracts to take. Each contract will involve player decisions and will impact the contract conclusion. The system controls the enemies during the battles.
There is also a story, a versus and an rpg mode to do your own thing. Age 12+

Fight to Survive: Role-playing Martial Arts Meets Heart
A heartbreaking, struggling, mundane, down-and-dirty game about martial artists in the 20th century where most situations are violent and usually end in sadness. Bloodsport, Streets of Fire, Hard Times, Final Fight, The Karate Kid, Ninja III: The Domination—the thrill of martial arts actions meets the hard streets of New Hope City. No experience with the system necessary. Be a part of the action, and join the fun.

Successfully Kickstarted and released just this summer, Fight to Survive: Role-playing Martial Arts Meets Heart is a brand new game from the indie weirdos at Radio James Games. Learn more at www.radiojamesgames.com.

games.Title: Denver The Last Dinosaur
games.Description: Now grown up the kids and denver work for a shady government organization investigating weird phenomenon.

games.Title: The First Crook
games.Description:
After plundering the treasure of the Devil Jonah himself, the crew of the Khamsin sailed East back toward Theah, to sell long-lost treasures back to the nations of origin. Halfway back to Theah, the crew began noticing changes. Despite being well fed and well rested, the crew became tired, listless and wasting away. Fearing a curse, the crew rifled through the Devil Jonah’s treasures until they came across a curved rod of gold and lapis lazuli. As a sailor touched it, their eyes became pure white and spoke of returning the heqa to its rightful owner in order to lift the wasting curse. Sailing for the Black Lands of Khemet, the crew hopes to free themselves of the plague of the Ennead.

7th Sea is a vastly narrative system of high adventure, high seas and wild magic. In this 17th-18th century parallel world, you can indulge in your inner swashbuckler, sail the vast oceans in search of mystical wonders and wily monsters. This d10 system encourages over-the-top action and drama. Set sail, landlubbers and come sail the 7th Sea!

games.Title: Still More Trouble with Adventurers
games.Description: You and your goblin tribe had done the impossible; you'd found a place for your people where you could be free of the bothersome races of Faerun. Or so you thought. The meddling long-legs and rock-breakers had to go poking around, and now they've woken something up. Something old, something that threatens the very ancient city you fought so hard to restore. Now you must gather a band of stalwart goblins and plumb the depths beneath the city to fix the mess those pesky adventurers have made. Still More Trouble with Adventurers is a 5e D&D 3rd-level adventure for 4-6 players. Pre-generated characters will be provided.

games.Title: A Bowling TTRPG
games.Description:
Strikes & Spares is a slice-of-life tabletop roleplaying game with a slightly hard-luck/offbeat tone that's set in a small-town league.

It's Friday night and Barney's Bowl-A-Rama has a full parking lot. You and your team ascend on the lanes like predators on prey, ready to take down some beer, nachos, and more than a few pins. It's league night, and 10 defiant pins stand between you and a crushing victory. It's time to show everyone what this middle-aged athlete can do.

Players: 3-5 Silly Fun - Non-Cooperative No experience Dice provided upon request

games.Title: Lost Citadel of the Scarlet Minotaur
games.Description: A 1st-level dungeon crawl for Shadowdark RPG where the characters delve into a ruined citadel hunting for legendary treasures while avoiding the wrath of the infamous scarlet minotaur!

games.Title: Hyperborea-Rel's Smile
games.Description: The vast city of Khromarium promises new opportunities for those starting adventurers looking for opportunity. A vast place of sprawling buildings and smoke stacks that billow plumes of black smoke from the many factories and shops within its city walls. Cramped city streets filled with the unwashed bodies of thousands with many amazing sites to behold. You are a new hopeful wide eyed visitor to the city. Perhaps good fortune has arrived finaly and Rel (the god of luck and adventurers) has indeed smiled upon you. Hyperborea is a OSR 1e AD&D game based fantasy RPG which combines the spirit of conan, cuthulu and a dash of science fiction.

Modern-day paranormal investigators based out of Ottawa.

Sessions will be based on ghost stories from around the Peterborough area.

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description: In the 2400s, mankind begins to terraform the planet Mars. Giant corporations, sponsored by the World Government on Earth, initiate huge projects to raise the temperature, the oxygen level, and the ocean coverage until the environment is habitable. In Terraforming Mars, you play one of those corporations and work together in the terraforming process, but compete for getting victory points that are awarded not only for your contribution to the terraforming, but also for advancing human infrastructure throughout the solar system, and doing other commendable things.

games.Title: Minature Wargame
games.Description: Across the far-flung worlds of the Imperium of Mankind, in a galaxy riven by warp storms and unceasing conflict, the armies of Humanity battle for survival. With the Imperium already standing upon the brink of annihilation, the Tyranid hive fleets emerge from the cold void between the stars. The Space Marines stand as the last line of defence between this ravenous alien menace and the beleaguered worlds of the Imperium.

games.Title: THE STONE OF ROC ROCK
games.Description:
Blurb: The Heroes of Heroton haven't returned from their quest for the holy Stone of Roc Rock. Now fate calls the Other, Other Heroes of Heroton: Illusionist! Assassin! Bard! Monk! Druid!

ELEMENTAL is a fast, flexible system for any character, any setting, any story! All players get a prize! https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/242198/ELEMENTAL-Complete-Guide?fbclid=IwAR1iiOCz6dT34VcKKQi65BRvRqHGuQy6X8G6P17x7Ov1kogUE2X7c-bX0sQ

Continuing a long-running series of Phantasm games; come back to the D&D Basic of yore, the original fantasy setting—when elf was a class, spells were few but mighty, and a common house-cat could kill your entire party. Level appropriate encounters? Pshaw! Peril! Few Hit Points! Save or DIE! This is the granddaddy of gritty. No XP necessary; bring only your dice, your ingenuity, and your sense of adventure.

games.Title: Alone in the Dark
games.Description:
In the fledgling age of space tourism, a spectacular orbital resort called Minerva was constructed in high orbit over the Earth. Boasting great amenities, the opportunity to experience zero G attractions and breathtaking views of the planet, it became one of the hottest tourist traps the world had ever seen. Then ten days ago, the world was plunged into darkness and Minerva could no longer reach the stations far below. What has happened to block the station’s view of Earth? And what is that sound…?

Ten Candles is a game of tragic horror and cooperative storytelling, where character death is inevitable. It’s not about the destination, but the journey. Can you find hope, before all Ten Candles go out? What stalks the shadows of the world? Let’s find out together! Collectively build (and destroy) characters over the course of the game until you meet your untimely end!

games.Title: The Pop-up House
games.Description: ou've found the perfect home. Sure, it needs a little work and it's a little outside of town, but you couldn't beat the price in the current market. Renovations aren't going quite as easily as expected, though. It feels like the measurements are always a little off, things are never quite level, and you definitely don't remember that closet being there. Now, the dreams you seem to share, dreams of a pop-up house curiously like this one, have you wondering just what you've moved into. The Pop-up House is a 7e Call of Cthulhu scenario for 4-6 players.  Pre-generated characters will be provided.

games.Title: UK1 – Beyond The Crystal Cave
games.Description: Come try a truly unique old school module from the heyday of TSR! Set on the island of Sybarate in the Greyhawk world setting, this module is unusual in that it encourages a non-violent approach (parleying and tactics) to achieving the module’s goals. The players take on the roles of important personages in Sybarate (pre-generated characters I have created for your use) that have been called upon by the Lord and Lady of Sybarate to carry out a pressing political task - find and safely return a young couple that eloped, against their noble families’ wishes, and that have been missing now for almost two years. Recent divinations have finally indicated that they may be trapped inside a mysterious magical garden at the center of Sybarate island created by a great wizard form long ago. Unfortunately for your party of would-be rescuers, no one in living memory has been able to figure out how to get into Porpherio’s Garden, let alone get out again! Will you take up the call?

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description: Encyclopedia is a dice-based worker placement game. At the beginning of each round, you’ll be drawing and rolling dice, then placing them on your player board. These dice can then be used to perform an action each turn, depending on their color and value. Your action can be preparing your expeditions by going to the Embassy, visiting the Bank to raise funds, or hiring your research team at the University. Once you’re ready to go, you’ll choose the Animal cards you wish to study, then organize expeditions to observe them in their natural habitats. When your research is complete, you’ll then be able to publish your findings in an attempt to become the biggest contributor to Buffon’s Encyclopedia. Every publication you make will earn you Victory points, and at the end of the game, you’ll score points based on collections of Animals and research amassed during play. The naturalist with the most points wins!

games.Title: Pudding Faire
games.Description: Enjoy the festivities and fun of the Annual Honey puddle pudding faire! Compete in contests for gold and prizes! Taste our delicious confections and ciders! Come and celebrate the Great Pudding on the biggest day of the year!

games.Title: Hyperborea-A Wayward Daughter
games.Description: The call for adventure has brought you to the small settlement of Entella far in the northern lands. This small community has a need for those strong of sword arm, stealth and sorcery. A warrior maidens smile and a promise of a vast treasure waiting to be taken. If you are brave enough that is ! Hyperborea is a OSR 1e AD&D game based fantasy RPG which combines the spirit of conan, cuthulu and a dash of science fiction.

Modern-day paranormal investigators based out of Ottawa.

Sessions will be based on ghost stories from around the Peterborough area.

games.Title: Board Game
games.Description: To be played with all expansions                                                                                                                                                                                                                  You are bird enthusiasts—researchers, bird watchers, ornithologists, and collectors—seeking to discover and attract the best birds to your network of wildlife preserves. Each bird extends a chain of powerful combinations in one of your habitats (actions).

storytellers.Name: Name
storytellers.Description: Description

storytellers.Name: Adam G
storytellers.Description: Adam started roleplaying when he was 8, and has played or GM'd in many systems, including Pathfinder, D20 Modern, Top Secret, Marvel and every version of D&D. He loves character and story driven games, and enjoys creatively interpreting rules whenever pla

storytellers.Name: Andrew V
storytellers.Description: Gamer since the early 80’s and designer since the early 90’s. Best known works are the Fate of the Norns line of games: Ragnarok, Gulveig and Vigridr.

storytellers.Name: Bryan M
storytellers.Description: For more than five years Bryan has been taking childhood memories and warping them into twisted games, that are just too much fun to pass up.

storytellers.Name: Chris C
storytellers.Description: Chris won the story teller of the year award in 2002 and next year will be publishing his first RPG game “Knights of the Hidden Sun”. Whenever you get the chance play with this man his games are too fun to pass up.

storytellers.Name: Craig M
storytellers.Description: Craig is a old school story teller, who has been running games for us every year since the first year of the convention. His game are quite fun, well worth checking out.

storytellers.Name: David W
storytellers.Description: Gaming started for me in grade two (2) when I played a mage that was magically teleported to the front of a roman legion. So I fireballed them. My GM (also in grade 2) wasn\'t to good with area calculations or math in general. So I vanquished the whole le

storytellers.Name: Dennis H
storytellers.Description: I have an extensive background running a wide range of game systems. Starting with AD&D in the early 80's and branching off in to other systems such as Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay, Gurps, Rolemaster, Rifts, Recon, Palladium, Shadowrun, Star Wars d6(west end) and many others. I have DM every version of D&D and I am currently the Local coordinator for D&D 5e for the Belleville area. I have run games at a variety of cons over the years Knight March, Orion, and of course Phantasm." I prefer to run games then play in them smile emoticon

storytellers.Name: Derek H
storytellers.Description: Derek has always been gaming in some sort of capacity. He picked up D&D in 1980 and started to DM in 1983 and has not stopped playing since. He's played Traveller, GURPS and all kinds of wierd wonderful RPGs. While still playing D&D/Pathfinder to this day

storytellers.Name: Ed Greenwood
storytellers.Description: Ed Greenwood is the creator of the Forgotten Realms fantasy world, which became the setting for his home D&D game in 1975. Play still continues in this long-running campaign, and Ed also keeps busy producing Realmslore for various TSR publications. Ed

storytellers.Name: Erik W
storytellers.Description: Erik was excited by an ad in Analog Magazine for something called Gamma World. The idea that playing pieces on a board could constitute a mechanism for enacting stories caught his imagination and it hasn't let him go. When not gaming, he teaches secondary school in Toronto and blogs about obscure aspects of theatre history, theory, and literature.

storytellers.Name: James K
storytellers.Description: In 1987 James Kerr placed a peanut butter sandwich in his parent's VCR and was transported to a magical world where he was taught by long-dead druids the secrets of dice rolling, community, and dungeon mastership. Returning to this world he has been playi

storytellers.Name: James L
storytellers.Description: Been away for a couple of years.  I am happy to be running a few events again for Phantasm. I am looking to try and get Palladium Books some recognition again as here in Peterborough it really is not known well at all.

storytellers.Name: Jason B
storytellers.Description: is a deviant mind of the highest caliber who has been running LARP for Phantasm for 7 years.

storytellers.Name: Jason M
storytellers.Description: is a two-time winner of the Hammer of Plot and overall awesome human being.  He is a GM that is all about keeping his players entertained.  His material is light on planning and heavy on over-the-top action.  If you attend Phantasm, you owe it to yourself

storytellers.Name: Jean Marc S
storytellers.Description: Jean-Marc has been coming out to the con for a while now and always is a con favourite. He runs a number of games of his own creation like \"Fallout\".

storytellers.Name: Jon Mark J
storytellers.Description: If we could find a way to harness this man’s energy we would solve the energy crisis hands down. Jon Mark runs a high energy game full of drama where hero exemplify what it is to be a hero.

storytellers.Name: Jon Moore
storytellers.Description: Jon has been playing and running games since he was 12 and purchased the D&D Red Box in a whim, over 20 years ago.  Moving quickly from D&D to Rifts, he owns a metric ton of all manner of Palladium Source material. Now well-dedicated to the GURPS system,

storytellers.Name: Jordan G
storytellers.Description: The Self-Proclaimed Overlord Game Master of Mississauga, Jordan has carved out a niche with his expansive library of over a hundred games; If you enjoy fast, light and fun RPGs you'll not be disappointed at his table.

storytellers.Name: Lawrence M
storytellers.Description: Lawrence we got from Orion, and we’re quite glad to have him. He runs D20 Cthulu for us, and puts a ton of effort into it.

storytellers.Name: Lawrence W
storytellers.Description: Lawrence Whitaker has been role-playing since the ice sheets started to recede and claims he has a genuine knuckle-bone d20 - although this might not be true. What is true is that Lawrence has over 25 years of experience as a player, GM and games writer.

storytellers.Name: Malcolm S
storytellers.Description: Malcolm Sheppard has been writing and designing roleplaying games for about a decade, beginning with material for White Wolf\'s classic Mage: The Ascension line. Since then he\'s gone to work on the current World of Darkness (Mage, Changeling and Geist),

storytellers.Name: Nathan D
storytellers.Description: I believe in stories because they define who we are.  An avid rpg’s since the first red book to the latest 5th edition, I bring decades of experience in storytelling to the table.  An avid 3d printer for the last 5 years, I bring over 500 3d printed terrain and scatter to the game.   I love telling stories in a visual and dramatic way.

storytellers.Name: Nick S
storytellers.Description: Nick puts a ton of effort and play testing into his games, its great to see a table get drawn into one of his woven tales.

storytellers.Name: Peter L
storytellers.Description: Peter L is a old school GM with a new school feel. He runs great games that focus on fun and letting the PC\'s be hero\'s who can do cool things.

storytellers.Name: Shawn L
storytellers.Description: I am currently a Press Ganger for Privateer Press, which is to say that I am a volunteer gameplay coordinator for Privateer Press Products. I've been doing this officially for just under a year, but have been demoing Privateer Press Products for three. I have been plying RPGs since I was 12 with an old copy of 1st edition Advanced Dungeons and Dragons, and have played multiple RPGs over the past 23 years both as a PC and as a Game Master. I expanded into Miniature war gaming with Warhammer 40,00 with an Eldar and a Space Wolves Army. I decided that after surviving the supposed end of the world of 2012, I felt that a great reward for my survivability would be learning to play a new game. I started playing Hordes and then moved to Include Warmachine. Recently I have started to add the iron Kingdoms RPG to my repertoire of games supported and have had a fantastic time hosting and playing this RPG.

storytellers.Name: Steve C
storytellers.Description: Steve runs these great games that focus around the players and build on their actions. If you get a chance you have to try some of the games of Steve\’s own design, they are pretty fun.

storytellers.Name: Steve E
storytellers.Description: Steve has the largest RPG collection I’ve ever seen. He loves to dive into new games and settings. When he runs a game he focuses entirely on the story and player’s enjoyment, the rules come second.

storytellers.Name: Dave G
storytellers.Description:
Ever since one kid brought the 3rd Ed starter box to school one day in 2000, my make belief had a framework that make it so much better, more fun and good deal more Epic.

With the new publishing/Kickstarter funding renewal for there are more games with more amazing mechanics than I could ever imagine.

Though little of that seems to matter because in the end the villains always seem to be Drow, Cults of the King in Yellow, or Mindflayers, just done in so many ways!

I have probably several dozen games on my shelf I've never tried and it's only with an adventurous group of players (with at least semi consistent schedules) that we'll get to see them all and discover all they have to offer.

I'm looking to immerse my players in the story and have three priorities in this order: fun, storyline, rules as written.
